research experience.name: Microsoft Research India
highlights:
Project Reward Copilot
Advisors: Dr. Nagarajan Natarajan, Dr. Mayukh Das
  • Working on Reward Copilot, a framework that facilitates the design of interpretable reward functions based on client specifications for any RL framework.

Project Network Brain
Advisors: Dr. Venkat Padmanabhan, Dr. Rohan Gandhi, Dr. Debopam Bhattacherjee
  • Optimizing geo-distributed training of large language models (LLMs).
  • Developing output sequence length predictors for LLMs to aid in downstream tasks.

Project CEISER
Advisors: Dr. Jayashree Mohan, Dr. Anand Iyer
  • Focused on reducing inference costs by substituting a single large ML model with an ensemble of smaller, heterogeneous models while maintaining accuracy and latency targets on a single GPU

Project OPPerTune    
Advisors: Dr. Nagarajan Natarajan, Dr. Ranjita Bhagwan
  • Created OPPerTune, a framework enabling apps in deployment to continuously optimize performance by tuning configuration parameters.
  • Developed a Python library for the RL tuning algorithms, a Go server to host the tuning pipeline, and a Lua benchmark (using wrk2) for testing server scalability. Also helped implement and optimize the tuning algorithms.
  • Integrated OPPerTune into Azure Resource Central, Microsoft's prediction serving platform, and open-sourced it.
  • OPPerTune is being used in Microsoft and is patented in the US.
Promoted from Research SDE to Research SDE 2 in August 2023.
